description: The UMD 4.9.1 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes dCache 5.2.10 and CVMFS 2.6.3 for CentOS7 and SL6. It also contains HTCondor 8.8.1, HTCondor-CE 3.2.1for CentOS7. WARNING: HTCondor and HTCondor-CE have been released in UMD 4.9.1 pointing to the original documentation and without providing EGI-specific installation and configuration guides.
releaseNotes:
This release contains the following products and updates for CentOS7 and SL6: <br><ul><li>dCache 5.2.10 - various bug fixes and improvements https://www.dcache.org/downloads/1.9/release-notes-5.2.shtml<br></li><li>CVMFS 2.6.3 - patch release. It fixes parsing of the /etc/hosts file for several corner cases </li></ul><div>This release contains also the following products for CentOS7:</div><div><ul><li>HTCondor 8.8.1 - HTCondor is a specialized workload management 
system for compute-intensive jobs. With this release of UMD, this 
version is included for the first time. Please refer to the HTCondor 
documentation for further details on this product: 
https://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual/</li><li>HTCondor-CE 3.2.1 -
 The HTCondor-CE software is a job gateway based on HTCondor for Compute
 Elements (CE) belonging to a computing grid.&nbsp; Please refer to the 
HTCondor-CE documentation for further details on this product: 
https://htcondor-ce.readthedocs.io/en/stable/</li></ul></div><br/><div><i><b>WARNING</b>: HTCondor and HTCondor-CE have been released in UMD 4.9.1 pointing to the original documentation and without providing EGI-specific installation and configuration guides. </i><br></div>
installationNotes: All products in UMD 4.9.1 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the distribution, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: operations (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report.

It fixes parsing of the /etc/hosts file for several corner cases </li></ul><div>This release contains also the following products for CentOS7:</div><div><ul><li>HTCondor 8.8.1 - HTCondor is a specialized workload management

products.name: cernvm.cvmfs
products.description: CernVM File System (CernVM-FS) is a network file system based on HTTP and optimized to deliver experiment software in a fast, scalable, and reliable way. Files and file metadata are aggressively cached and downloaded on demand. Thereby the CernVM-FS decouples the life cycle management of the application software releases from the operating system. CernVM-FS is included in CernVM, however it can also be used outside CernVM.

products.name: chtc.condor
products.description: HTCondor is a specialized workload management system for compute-intensive jobs. Like other full-featured batch systems, HTCondor provides a job queueing mechanism, scheduling policy, priority scheme, resource monitoring, and resource management. Users submit their serial or parallel jobs to HTCondor, HTCondor places them into a queue, chooses when and where to run the jobs based upon a policy, carefully monitors their progress, and ultimately informs the user upon completion.
products.changeLog: This is the stable release series of HTCondor.

products.name: chtc.htcondor-ce
products.description:
HTCondor-CE is a special configuration of the HTCondor software designed to be a job gateway solution for the OSG. It is configured to use the JobRouter daemon to delegate jobs by transforming and submitting them to the site's batch system. Currently HTCondor suppots LSF, PBS and TORQUE, SGE, and Slurm batch systems.

Also an HTCondor-CE GLUE2 provider for HTCondor-CE is available here.
products.changeLog: This is the stable release series of HTCondor-CE.

products.name: dcache.dcache
products.description: dCache provides system for storing and retrieving huge amounts of data, distributed among a large number of heterogenous server nodes, under a single virtual filesystem tree with a variety of standard access methods.
